issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: RetryInvocationHandler need wrap InterruptedException in IOException when call Thread.sleep. Otherwise InterruptedException can't be handled correctly by other components such as HDFS.
fields.summary: RetryInvocationHandler need wrap InterruptedException in IOException when call Thread.sleep

comments.body:
Thanks [~zxu] for working on this. 

bq. Otherwise InterruptedException can't be handled correctly by other components such as HDFS.

Could you please elaborate more about how HDFS fails to handle the InterruptException correctly?

This message was automatically generated.

It looks like the problem is that if the thread sleeping for a retry is interrupted, it's thrown all the way up and things expecting IOEs don't like that.

Wrapping would fix that, but it MUST be an {{InterruptedIOException}}, so that the fact there wasn't interrupt doesn't get lost in the chain.

However: is it that the right action? What about rethrowing the exception that was being retried?

+1 for throwing {{InterruptedIOException}}. 

Currently if the interruption happens in the {{RetryInvocationHandler}} level, the thread that is making the RPC call (and also is blocked in the RPC call) gets interrupted (instead of a worker thread inside of the RPC Client.java). Thus looks like the upper level caller aims to interrupt the RPC invocation. So I think throwing {{InterruptedIOException}} may be better than throwing the exception that was being retried.

Thanks for the review, [~stevel@apache.org] and [~jingzhao]! Yes, throwing InterruptedIOException makes sense to me also. I attached a new patch HADOOP-13249.001.patch which use InterruptedIOException instead of IOException, Please review it. thanks.

This message was automatically generated.

If InterruptException is triggered, it will be contained in an UndeclaredThrowableException because InterruptException is an undeclared checked exception that is thrown by the invocation handler. Currently UndeclaredThrowableException is not handled by DFSClient and layerâ€“up.
thanks for the review [~jingzhao]! Good comments! I attached a new patch HADOOP-13249.002.patch which addressed all your comments. Please review it!
